trans-unit.source: Provides basic design-time functionality for ASP.NET server controls.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the DHTML behavior that is associated with the designer.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.Behavior%2A> property is obsolete.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerTag.SetAttribute%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerTag.GetAttribute%2A> methods on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.Tag%2A> property to map properties to styles.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeCssAttributes%2A> method on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> class to set styles for the control at design time.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.IHtmlControlDesignerBehavior"></xref> that is associated with the designer.
Gets the data bindings collection for the current control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataBindingCollection"></xref> that contains the data bindings for the current control.
Gets the design-time object representing the control that is associated with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner"></xref> object on the design surface.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.DesignTimeElement%2A> property is used by the designer to retrieve the design-time object representing the control that is associated with the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner> object on the design surface.
The design-time object representing the control associated with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner"></xref>.
Releases the unmanaged resources that are used by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner"></xref> object and optionally releases the managed resources.
This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method.
`Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`.
<xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.
When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner> references.
This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Gets the expression bindings for the current control at design time.

The design host, such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/includes/vsprvslong-md.md)], uses the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ExpressionBuilder> class to get the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionEditor> class to get the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionEditorSheet> to set expressions for control properties at design time.
Expression strings reference a localizable resource, an application setting, a connection string, or a custom expression type.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.Expressions%2A> collection contains an <xref:System.Web.UI.ExpressionBinding> element for each control property that has an associated expression string.
Each <xref:System.Web.UI.ExpressionBinding.ExpressionPrefix%2A> property for each element indicates the associated expression builder implementation.
The expression string is parsed and evaluated by its associated <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ExpressionBuilder> to determine the control property value at run time.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.ExpressionBindingCollection"></xref> that contains the expressions strings set for properties in the current control.
Initializes the designer and sets the component for design.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.Initialize%2A> method should be called by the designer host to initialize the designer.
The control element for design.
Called when a behavior is associated with the element.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.OnBehaviorAttached%2A> method is obsolete.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerTag.SetAttribute%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerTag.GetAttribute%2A> methods on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.Tag%2A> property to map properties to styles.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeCssAttributes%2A> method on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> class to set styles for the control at design time.
Override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.Initialize%2A> method to manipulate the initial styles for the control at design time.
Called when a behavior disassociates from the element.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.OnBehaviorDetaching%2A> method is obsolete.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerTag.SetAttribute%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerTag.GetAttribute%2A> methods on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.Tag%2A> property to map properties to styles.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeCssAttributes%2A> method on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> class to set styles for the control at design time.
Override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.Dispose%2A> method for the control designer to perform actions before the designer object is released.
Provides a method that can be used to indicate when a data binding has changed.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.OnBindingsCollectionChanged%2A> method should be called by a control designer after the control designer has made a change to the data bindings for the control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.OnBindingsCollectionChanged%2A> method is obsolete.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBindingCollection.Changed> event on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.DataBindings%2A> collection for equivalent control designer functionality.
The name of the property that has changed.
Provides a way to perform additional processing when the associated control is attached to a parent control.
Sets the list of events that are exposed at design-time for the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor"></xref> object for the component.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.PreFilterEvents%2A> method provides a way to add items to or remove items from the dictionary of events that a designer exposes through a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> object.
The keys in the dictionary of events are the names of the events.
The objects are of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor>.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> that contains the names of the events of the component to expose.
Allows the designer to expose a specific set of properties through a <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor"></xref> object at design time.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method provides a way to add items to or remove items from the dictionary of properties that a designer exposes through a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> object.
The keys in the dictionary of properties are the names of the properties.
The objects are of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor>.
The set of properties to filter for the component.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to create a field declaration for the control in the code-behind file for the current design document during serialization.
`true`, if a declaration should be created; otherwise, `false`.
